dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4785 IH: American Customer Information Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Huizenga (for himself and Mr. Hultgren) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To prohibit the consolidated audit trail from accepting personally identifying information, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Customer Information Protection Act.

section.header: No acceptance of personally identifying information

subsection.text: The consolidated audit trail may not accept personally identifying information.
Subsection (a) shall not apply to information accepted by the consolidated audit trail in connection with large traders.

paragraph.text: The term consolidated audit trail means the consolidated audit trail created by the national market system plan approved pursuant to section 242.613 and section 242.608 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation).
The term large trader has the meaning given that term under section 13(h)(8) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78m(h)(8)).
The term personally identifying information includesâ€”

subparagraph.text: other customer identifying information, when taken alone or together, sufficient to identify an individual, such as names, addresses, dates of birth, account numbers; and
any other information the Securities and Exchange Commission determines could be defined as personally identifying information.
